Overview: 
  The EPA National Student Services Contract has an immediate opening for a full time Web Application Developer position with the Office of Research and Development at the EPA facility in Corvallis, OR. 
The Office of Research and Development at the EPA supports high-quality research to improve the scientific basis for decisions on national environmental issues and help EPA achieve its environmental goals. Research is conducted in a broad range of environmental areas by scientists in EPA laboratories and at universities across the country. 
What the EPA project is about

Within CPHEA, the Pacific Ecology System Division (PESD) is responsible for research to assess the condition of freshwater, terrestrial, and estuarine ecosystems, and how environmental condition affects beneficial uses of those ecosystems.

 This research goal of this position is to continue development and help with maintenance for a set of web tools that give public access to EPA data and models.
 


 The proposed work involves development and maintenance of a tool (e.g. web-based dashboard to provide access to a published set of EPA watershed data.) The contractor will assist in the refinement and maintenance of these web tools.
 

 Responsibilities: 
 
   The contractor will assist in refinement, testing, and maintaining web service tools that serve and allow access to EPA data. In addition, the contractor may be asked to assist in database maintenance and development efforts.
 

 Working with other contractors designing and implementing initial tool prototypes;
 Working with EPA staff to design, implement and test tools;
 Working with possible users of tool to create use cases and design requirements;
 Writing documentation for the tool; and
 Implementing new tool features and bug fixes.

 Working with other contractors designing and implementing initial tool;
 Working with EPA staff to design, implement and test;
 Working with possible users of tool to create use cases and design;
 Writing documentation for the tools;
 Maintaining and working with backend relational database;
 Maintaining and updating an existing application programming interface (API); and
 Implementing new tool features and bug.

 Interact with other members of the development team as well as EPA.

 Significant experience in developing interactive web applications with experience beyond student projects;

 Experience with user interface design;
 Experience in working with stakeholders for application; and
 Strong written, oral and electronic communication.

Be at least 18 years of age and
 Have earned at least a Bachelor’s degree in computer science or a degree in a scientific discipline with demonstrated software development skills, or a closely related field of study from an accredited university or college within the last 24 months and
